column5: Hey All,Heading back up to Melchett again in couple of weeks. Anyone been up there lately? What are the lake levels like?Thanks!
Water is gonna be low unless we get some rain soon, it is up river anyway. Haven't been to Melchett, but it should get a little pressure this weekend with the Aroland Fish Derby going on.
Thanks. Sorry, but what do you mean by pressure this weekend?
The natives in Aroland can access many lakes up there legally with vehicle.
The derby is not only Melchett, its on a bunch of lakes in the area. There some that will be on Melchett thats all. Nothing too serious.
Thank you both for the feedback.

we fished it one year the tournament was going on only seen them once. Their camp is on the ssw side of the lake or, on the last island before you hit the main lake on the se side . So go enjoy the fishing !
just bringing this back up to the top.

Thanks and good to hear. We have experienced both high water and low water levels in the many trips we've had to Melchett. As you said, the fishing has always been fantastic. Low water just means we'll have to be little slower boating in a few spots.Which part up river were you in?
I was on Stewart, about an hour boat ride down river from the bridge.
